'''Joseph "Joey" Anthony Barton''' (born [[2 September]] [[1982]]) ({{IPAEng|ËdÊÉÊiË ËbÉËtÊn}}) is an [[England|English]] [[football (soccer)|footballer]]. He is currently serving a six month prison term and plays for English [[Premier League]] club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], as a [[midfielder]].
Barton was born in [[Huyton]], [[Merseyside]] and raised in a rough area and, as a child, he saw football as a form of escapism.<ref name="Joey Barton's damning verdict on football's pampered elite">{{cite news|url=http://www.people.co.uk/sport/football/tm_headline=joey-barton-s-damning-verdict-on-football-s-pampered-elite-&method=full&objectid=18276729&siteid=93463-name_page.html|first=Paul|last=McCarthy|date=[[2006-12-17]] |accessdate=2007-07-11 |title=Joey Barton's damning verdict on football's pampered elite |publisher=''People.co.uk''}}</ref> He began his football career with [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in 2002 after working his way through their youth system. His appearances in the senior side gradually increased over the following five years and he made more than 150 for the club. Impressive form at club level earned him his first [[cap (sport)|cap]] for the [[England national football team|England national team]] in February 2007,<ref name="England 0-1 Spain">{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/6330177.stm |accessdate=2007-07-09 |title=England 0-1 Spain| last=Sinnott |first=John| publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> despite his criticism of some of the team's players. He joined his current club Newcastle United for a fee of Â£5.8 million in July 2007.<ref name="Barton completes move to Magpies">{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/6725067.stm |accessdate=2007-07-10 |title=Barton completes move to Magpies| last=Hunter |first= Andy| publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
Barton was born in [[Huyton]], [[Merseyside]] and raised in a rough area and, as a child, he saw football as a form of escapism.<ref name="Joey Barton's damning verdict on football's pampered elite">{{cite news|url=http://www.people.co.uk/sport/football/tm_headline=joey-barton-s-damning-verdict-on-football-s-pampered-elite-&method=full&objectid=18276729&siteid=93463-name_page.html|first=Paul|last=McCarthy|date=[[2006-12-17]] |accessdate=2007-07-11 |title=Joey Barton's damning verdict on football's pampered elite |publisher=''People.co.uk''}}</ref> He began his football career with [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in 2002 after working his way through their youth system. His appearances in the senior side gradually increased over the following five years and he made more than 150 for the club. Impressive form at club level earned him his first [[cap (sport)|cap]] for the [[England national football team|England national team]] in February 2007,<ref name="England 0-1 Spain">{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/6330177.stm |accessdate=2007-07-09 |title=England 0-1 Spain| last=Sinnott |first=John| publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> despite his criticism of some of the team's players. He joined his current club Newcastle United for a fee of Â£5.8 million in July 2007.<ref name="Barton completes move to Magpies">{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/6725067.stm |accessdate=2007-07-10 |title=Barton completes move to Magpies| last=Hunter |first= Andy| publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
